title: 115_hr3871
content: The "Organic Farmer and Consumer Protection Act of 2017" authorizes appropriations for the National Organic Program, with increasing amounts allocated for fiscal years 2018 to 2023. Additionally, it includes provisions for the modernization and improvement of international trade technology systems and data collection. The Organic Foods Production Act of 1990 is amended to modernize international trade tracking and data collection systems for the national organic program, including the use of electronic trade document exchange systems. $5,000,000 from the Commodity Credit Corporation funds is allocated for this purpose in fiscal year 2019. Additional funds are provided for maintaining the database and technology upgrades. SEC. 4. RECORDKEEPING, INVESTIGATION, AND ENFORCEMENT. The Organic Foods Production Act of 1990 is amended to modernize international trade tracking and data collection systems for the national organic program. $5,000,000 from the Commodity Credit Corporation funds is allocated for this purpose in fiscal year 2019. Additional funds are provided for maintaining the database and technology upgrades. The Organic Foods Production Act of 1990 is amended to allow collaborative investigations and enforcement by sharing confidential information among parties involved. The Secretary will have access to data from cross-border documentation systems for enforcement purposes. The Organic Foods Production Act of 1990 is amended to allow collaborative investigations and enforcement by sharing confidential information among parties involved. The Secretary will have access to data from cross-border documentation systems for enforcement purposes, including the Automated Commercial Environment system of the U.S. Customs and Border Patrol and the Phytosanitary Certificate Issuance and Tracking system of the Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service. The Secretary can require additional documentation or verification before granting certification in areas of known risk or concern. The Secretary of Agriculture will issue regulations within a year to limit operations excluded from certification under section 205.101 of title 7, Code of Federal Regulations. SEC. 5. ADDITIONAL ACCREDITATION AUTHORITY. Amends the Organic Foods Production Act to give the Secretary oversight over certifying agents in foreign countries. SEC. 6. ANNUAL REPORT. The Organic Foods Production Act of 1990 is amended to require the Secretary to submit an annual report to Congress by March 1, detailing national organic program activities, investigations, and compliance actions taken domestically and overseas.
